content.description:
A bit right of the center of the crag, an obvious botton-to-top crack system that starts as two cracks and ends as a single crack.

This is a good little climb for the grade. I give it a star mostly for the nifty undercling early on.
content.protection: Standard rack. One fairly large cam is helpful at the start.

climbs.name: Scotch with a Twist
climbs.fa: Warren Mellinger, Ben Chapman, Jaime Lara, April 1986

content.description: This climbs the right-leaning cracks, above a brown scoop, on the left side of the face.

climbs.name: Scotch
climbs.fa: Ben Chapman, Warren Mellinger & Jaime Lara, February 1985

content.description: Climb the piton scarred crack about six feet right of "Scotch With a Twist", then up and left to the top.
This is the face just right of Haberdashery.
content.location: Located at the Circle Crag, right of the seats and little building.  Goes up the largest section of the rock just right of Haberdashery.

content.description: A crimpy and balance kind of climb. Its definitely worth the effort to set up a toprope because the crux is near the top and a fall could result in some folded ankles or worse. If you want to do this as a highball just bring all of the crash pads and some trusted spotters.
content.protection: Solid opportunity for a TR anchor up top with camalots from 3"-5" fitting in a vertical left facing crack and a straight in crack on the ledge that fits .75"-2" camalots.
content.location: Start at the amphitheater and face the benches. 45° to the right you should be able to spot A.A.s very prominent crack. The route is located 10 ft. to the right of the start of A.A.

content.description:
Start on

A.A.

and then cut right on a ledge to finish up an obvious left-facing lieback flake.
Climb a double crack system with an undercut start and then wander up easy cracks to the top.
content.location:
Located on the left side of the face and 15 feet left of

Scotch with a Twist

.

content.description: This is an obvious black stained crack which extends from bottom to top.
content.location:
Located 10 feet right of

Whiskey

; it is the left of two parallel cracks.

climbs.name: Have a Beer with Fear
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Rick Briggs, February 1993

content.description:
This is the most obvious crack a ways to the right of

A.A.

.

This left-leaning crack is seen on the first rock, to the right when walking to the campfire circle on a formation that is separate from the main Circle Crag. This is the left of two cracks seen on the crag. Move up into the main crack, passing a small bush, the jam and lieback to the top.

climbs.name: Gin Fizz
climbs.fa: Ben Chapman, Warren Mellinger, Jaime Lara & Dick Seward, February 1985

content.description: Climb the face about 10' right of "Scotch".
Climb a short thin and shallow crack to a ledge.  Here the crack widens to splitter wide hands.  Follow the crack to the top.
content.protection: Small gear for the bottom (aliens or nuts) and wide gear for the top and anchor (#2-3 camalots).
content.location: The right side of circle crag.  The wide crack is obvious and splits what looks like a boulder sitting on a ledge 10-15 feet above the ground.  Easy walk off back.
